name: NET Ampulla T
title: Clinical and Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:** TNM does not include an in situ category for Neuroendocrine Tumors (NET) of the ampulla of Vater. Assign TX and behavior code /2 for in situ cases.

**Note 2:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 3:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1 or T2) based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined/limited to ampulla of Vater or extending to sphincter of Oddi
    Duodenal wall

    Confined to ampulla, NOS
    Localized, NOS
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive
Unknown extension
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record

Confined to ampulla and size not known
Tumor invades lamina propria or submucosa and is no greater than 1 cm in size
Tumor invades muscularis propria or is greater than 1 cm in size
Jejunal or ileal tumor invades subserosa pullary or duodenal tumor invades pancreas or retro-peritoneum

Pancreas
Peripancreatic soft tissues
Retroperitoneum

Stated as T3
Tumor perforates visceral peritoneum (serosa) or invades other organs or adjacent structures

Common bile duct
Extrahepatic bile ducts other than common bile duct or sphincter of Oddi

Extension to other adjacent organs or tissues:
    Blood vessels (major):
        Hepatic artery
        Portal vein
    Gallbladder
    Hepatic flexure
    Lesser omentum
    Liver including porta hepatis
    Stomach, NOS:
        Distal
    Transverse colon

Stomach, proximal

Further contiguous extension:
    Other adjacent organs

Stated as T4
